It is characterized by its unique fronds that are divided into small, linear segments, giving it a distinctive appearance. This fern is typically found in moist, shaded environments, often in temperate regions with high humidity. Its reproductive structures, including sporangia, are located on the underside of the fronds, a common feature among ferns. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Hemionitis gleichenioides is considered a sensitive indicator of ecological health.
